p: In contrast to RIG-1, MDA-5 recognizes relatively long (more than 2 kb) dsRNA, and therefore it is a sensor of other types of viruses, particularly, encephalomyocarditis virus [ 35]. It is suggested that MDA-5 is the dominant cytoplasmic receptor for a complex of polyinosinic and polycytidylic acids (PolyI:PolyC) [ 38].
